isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SHIFT CONTROL LINKAGE ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE WITH MANUAL TRANSMISSION - ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Outlined below is the procedure for adjusting the shift control linkage.

step1.para: Tilt the cab fully forward (Refer to cab tilting instructions in the vehicle Operator's Manual).

With the transmission in "NEUTRAL," check to see that the remote outer shift lever is perpendicular with the top plane of the transmission housing (Angle A, Figure 7) when viewed from the side of the vehicle.
If the lever angle is not approximately 90 degrees, remove the lever and reposition it on the splined shaft.

note.para: The lever angle should be as close to 90 degrees as possible. The splines may not allow exactly 90 degrees.

step1.para: Place the transmission in the "MIDPOINT OF NEUTRAL" ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Location of Midpoint of Neutral

calloutgroup.callout1: A. TRANSMISSIONS WITH THREE SHIFT RAILS
B. TRANSMISSIONS WITH FOUR SHIFT RAILS

step1.para: To obtain "MIDPOINT OF NEUTRAL," manipulate the shift mechanism to place all the shift rails in neutral (midpoint of their front to rear travel) and to position the remote control shift shaft midway in its left to right travel.

With the transmission in "MIDPOINT OF NEUTRAL" check the position of the control rod ball on the upper (front) end of the rod assembly. The center line of ball and stud should be vertical when viewed from the rear of the vehicle ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Proper Position of Control Rod Ball

calloutgroup.callout1: V. CENTERLINE OF BALL AND STUD TO BE VERTICAL

step1.para: If the control rod ball is not vertical, loosen the lock nuts and turn the turnbuckle (Item 2, Figure 13) to lengthen or shorten the pivot rod as needed to rotate the control rod and place it in a vertical position. Tighten the lock nuts as specified in the TORQUE CHART.
Lower the cab to the driving position.
Remove the four screws and remove the shift lever seal retainer from the shift lever housing in the cab ( Figure 1).
Push the shift lever seals (upper and lower) up onto the shift lever ( Figure 1).

With the transmission in the "MIDPOINT OF NEUTRAL," check for the position of the shift lever in relation to the mounting surface of the shift lever housing. The lower end of the shift lever should be approximately perpendicular with the mounting surface of the housing as viewed from the driver's side of the vehicle (Angle B, Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Proper Position of the Shift Lever

step1.para: If the shift lever position is not within specified limits, loosen the shift lever-to-shift lever housing mounting bolts (Item 4, Figure 15) and reposition the shift lever as needed to obtain the specified angle. The shift lever housing has slotted holes to permit adjustment ( Figure 15). Apply Loctite Heavy Duty Loc N' Seal to the threads of the shift lever mounting bolts and tighten to 13 - 16 ft-lbs. (18 - 22 N•m). The part number for Loctite in the 6ml tube is 576016C, the 18ml tube is 576017C and the 50ml tube is 576018C.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. SHIFT LEVER MOUNTING SURFACE WITH SLOTTED HOLES

step1.para: In some cases it may be necessary to adjust the length of the control rod assembly to obtain the correct position of the shift lever. This can be done by loosening the selection lever-to-control rod clamp bolt (Item 3, Figure 4) and changing the position of the selection lever in the control rod. The control rod has slotted holes to permit adjustment. Tighten to 14 - 16 ft-lbs. (19 - 22 N•m).
When the correct shift lever position is obtained, re-install the shift lever seals and the retainer. Replace the seals if damaged.

Lower the cab and inspect for control rod operating clearance. Make sure the control rod does not contact the control support bracket (Item 2, Figure 16), engine, frame or other vehicle components that could interfere with the shift control linkage.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Clearance Between Control Rod and Control Rod Support Bracket

step1.para: Road test the vehicle and check the operation of the shift control linkage.
